andrzej.appdemo.shipwar

Class ShipwarController

  • java.lang.Object
    • andrzej.appdemo.shipwar.ShipwarController

  • @Controller
public class ShipwarController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for managing the responses to requests generated by the user who plays ships.
    Author:
    Pawe≈Ç Guzik

      This method maps the positions of the ships from the 'user' and 'enemy' objects to the model which is sent to the page where the game status is displayed

      Checks whether the user has correctly set up the ships and tries to find enemy for current user If there is an enemy ready to play, his id is assigned to logged in user and variable gameId is set to 3 that means users are playing game now.

    • Method Detail

      • showShipwarPage

        @GET
 @RequestMapping(value="/shipwar")
public java.lang.String showShipwarPage(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Takes the logged in user sets his gameId to 1 and reset variable warTable which represents ships on the board then adds user to the model attributes and send it to the shipwarAJAX page.
        Parameters:
        model - the model supply attributes used for rendering views.
        Returns:
        JSP page with the board on which user place his ships.

      • updateShip

        @GET
 @RequestMapping(value="/updateShip")
public void updateShip(@RequestParam(value="id")
                                                                    java.lang.String shipPos,
                                                                    org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Takes the logged in user and sets ship position in MySQL database as '1' character in 64-character String which represents the board of user ships.
        Parameters:
        shipPos - position that the ship should take on the board.
        model - the model supply attributes used for rendering views.

      • showPlayPage

        @GET
 @RequestMapping(value="/play")
public java.lang.String showPlayPage(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Checks whether the user has correctly set up the ships and tries to find enemy for current user If there is an enemy ready to play, his id is assigned to logged in user and variable gameId is set to 3 that means users are playing game now.
        Parameters:
        model - the model supply attributes used for rendering views.
        Returns:
        the play.jsp page if users are ready to play or shipwarAJAX.jsp if ships placed on board by currently logged in user are not right or waiting.jsp if there is no ready to play enemy for current user

      • updateAfterEnemyshot

        @GET
 @RequestMapping(value="/shot")
public java.lang.String updateAfterEnemyshot(@RequestParam(value="id")
                                                                                    java.lang.String shipPos,
                                                                                    org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Is responsible for the exchange of fire and setting, which the opponent can actually do his round. Checks if any of the opponents have destroyed all ships and if yes then ends the game.
        Parameters:
        shipPos - position that the player is firing at
        model - the model supply attributes used for rendering views.
        Returns:
        the endGame.jsp if there are no ships left or play.jsp if the players still have ships

      • endGameForJsp

        private void endGameForJsp(org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                           andrzej.appdemo.user.User user,
                           java.lang.String s)
        Clears data about players of the completed game, and provides information whether the player won or lost to the page informing about the end of this game.
        Parameters:
        model - the model supply attributes used for rendering views.
        user - user who lost or won the game.
        s - relevant information about winning or losing, sent to the user.

      • resetPlayerDataWhenLogout

        @GET
 @RequestMapping(value="/logout_success")
public java.lang.String resetPlayerDataWhenLogout(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Informs that the user has been correctly logged out.
        Parameters:
        model - the model supply attributes used for rendering views.
        Returns:
        the logout_success.jesp page with user name

      • reloadActiveUser

        @GET
 @RequestMapping(value="/reload")
public java.lang.String reloadActiveUser(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Checks which player can make the move and generates a response with this information for the script on the play.jsp page
        Parameters:
        model - the model supply attributes used for rendering views.
        Returns:
        the contentRefresh.jsp page with information about currently playing user

      • saveShipPos

        private void saveShipPos(java.lang.String shipPos,
                         andrzej.appdemo.user.User user)
        Saves the ship's position in the database as the number 1 in the 64-character string variable.
        Parameters:
        shipPos - the position of the ship that will be saved to the base
        user - the player for whom we save the position of the ship

      • mapWarTable

        private void mapWarTable(andrzej.appdemo.user.User user,
                         org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                         java.lang.String prefix)
        Maps the table representing the location of the player's ships to the model passed on the page displaying user boards
        Parameters:
        user - the user whose table will be mapped
        model - the model to which the user's table will be mapped
        prefix - variable intended to change the name of the mapped attribute in the model

      • findEnemy

        private void findEnemy(org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                       andrzej.appdemo.user.User user,
                       andrzej.appdemo.user.User enemy)
        This method maps the positions of the ships from the 'user' and 'enemy' objects to the model which is sent to the page where the game status is displayed
        Parameters:
        model - the model supply attributes used for rendering views.
        user - the user whose ship's positions will be transcribed to the game page.
        enemy - the user whose ship's positions will be transcribed to the game page on the opponent's side.
